intro: Cryptantha dissita, commonly known as the scattered flax or desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cryptantha dissita is often found in open areas such as grasslands and desert scrub, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
